Detailed Description

A dialog to edit the sign posts of a certain connection.

It is possible to remove sign posts from the connection or add new ones. It is not (yet) possible to update (change) the name of a sign post, since this functionality is not implemented in extra data handling. The dialog is very similar to the MEEditNameDialog.

Definition at line 38 of file MEEditSignPostDialog.h.

Member Function Documentation

void MEEditSignPostDialog::cancelPressed (   )  [protected]
 

Method that is called when the cancel-button is pressed.

This will cancel any changes that are done to the sign post name.

mapArea The map-area where the sign posts are located.

Returns:
The one and only MEEditSignPostDialog.

void MEEditSignPostDialog::internalHide (   )  [protected]
 

Close the dialog and reset the map.

That is: redraw the names in the info dialog.

void MEEditSignPostDialog::okPressed (   )  [protected]
 

Method that is called when the ok-button is pressed.

This will commit all changes that are done to the sign post name = add a new sign post or update the name of an existing. Note that updateSignpost is not implemented.

void MEEditSignPostDialog::removeNamePressed (   )  [protected]
 

Method that is called when the removeName-button is pressed.

This will remove the selected sign post name.

void MEEditSignPostDialog::setName (  int  spIndex,
OldConnection *  conn,
uint32  toNodeID
) 
 

Set the sign post name that should be edited/added.

If the spIndex is greater than the number of sign posts for the given connection, a new sign post is added.

Parameters:
spIndex The cardinal number of the sign post to edit. If more than the number of sign posts for conn, a new sign post is added.
conn The connection to edit/add sign post for.
toNodeID Where the connections leads TO.

MESignPostInfoDialog* MEEditSignPostDialog::m_parent [protected]
 

The sign post info dialog that created this edit dialog.

To be able to update the sign post list of the info dialog when a name has been removed/added/changed.

Definition at line 114 of file MEEditSignPostDialog.h.

int MEEditSignPostDialog::m_spIndex [protected]
 

The sign post index in m_connection.

Valid value if to edit/remove a sign post name is 0 <= m_spIndex < m_conection->getNbrSignPost(). If the value is outside this range, a new sign post will be added to m_connection.
